items.sentence: Mary bit her lip to keep from laughing again.
Perhaps Tom and Mary should do that together.
It was really kind of you to help me do that.
I'm pretty sure that Tom won't do that again.
I'm pretty sure that Tom is going to do that.
I need to know what time you plan to do that.
I haven't told Tom that I'm going to do that.
I don't usually do that, but I did yesterday.
Did you know that Tom didn't need to do that?
Did you know that Tom didn't have to do that?
Tom told Mary he wouldn't ever do that again.
Tom told everybody he was through doing that.
Tom told everybody he was tempted to do that.
Tom told everyone he was prepared to do that.
Tom thinks doing that wouldn't be a bad idea.
Tom thinks doing that may not be a good idea.
Tom says he'd be willing to do that for free.
Tom said that he wished you wouldn't do that.
Tom said that he thought he ought to do that.
Tom said that he thought he couldn't do that.
